Service.name: Asylum Application Support
Service.description: Assistance provided to asylum seekers during the process of submitting an asylum application, including guidance through the administrative procedures.

Service.name: Housing for Asylum Seekers
Service.description: Provision of temporary accommodation for asylum seekers during the processing of their applications.

Service.name: Legal Aid for Asylum Seekers
Service.description: Legal support provided to asylum seekers, including assistance with appeals against asylum decisions and other legal matters related to their status.

Service.name: Healthcare Access
Service.description: Facilitation of access to healthcare services for asylum seekers, including enrollment in health insurance programs and access to emergency medical care.

Service.name: Vocational Training
Service.description: Provision of vocational training programs to improve employability and professional skills for immigrants and refugees.

Service.name: Child Protection for Unaccompanied Minors
Service.description: Support and protection services for unaccompanied foreign minors, including housing, education, and legal representation.

Service.name: Family Reunification Assistance
Service.description: Support services to assist with the process of family reunification for refugees and immigrants, including legal guidance and administrative support.

Service.name: Emergency Social Assistance
Service.description: Immediate assistance provided to individuals in crisis, including shelter, food, and emergency financial aid.

Service.name: Social and Professional Integration
Service.description: Programs aimed at helping immigrants integrate into society and the workforce, including language classes, job placement, and social services.

Service.name: Administrative Support for Immigrants
Service.description: Assistance with administrative procedures related to immigration, such as applying for residence permits, work permits, and other official documentation.

Service.name: Support for Victims of Human Trafficking
Service.description: Specialized services for individuals who have been victims of human trafficking, including legal aid, psychological support, and assistance with reintegration.

Service.name: Language Training
Service.description: Language classes provided to immigrants and refugees to help them acquire proficiency in French, aiding their integration into society.

Service.name: Youth Services
Service.description: Services targeted at young immigrants, including education, vocational training, and recreational activities.

Service.name: Mental Health Support
Service.description: Access to mental health services for immigrants and refugees, including counseling and psychiatric care.

Service.name: Job Search Assistance
Service.description: Programs designed to assist immigrants and refugees in finding employment, including job placement services and career counseling.

Service.name: Financial Aid for Immigrants
Service.description: Provision of financial assistance to immigrants and refugees in need, including emergency funds and aid for specific needs like housing or education.

Service.name: Support for Disabled Immigrants
Service.description: Specialized services for immigrants and refugees with disabilities, including accessibility support and tailored assistance.

Service.name: Elderly Care Services
Service.description: Services aimed at supporting elderly immigrants, including healthcare, social services, and assistance with daily living activities.

Service.name: Women Protection Services
Service.description: Services dedicated to protecting immigrant women, including support for victims of domestic violence and gender-based violence.

Service.name: Public Awareness Campaigns
Service.description: Campaigns aimed at raising awareness about the rights of immigrants and refugees, combating discrimination, and promoting social cohesion.
